ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Did you request medical treatment or counseling for any EMOTIONAL PROBLEMS
IN THE PAST 3 MONTHS, how many visits did you have for your emotional problems?
Notes: 1= Only 1; 2= 2 to 5; 3= 6 to 10; 4= 10 to 20; 5= More than 20 visits

ElementDescription: In the past 3 months, have you gone for treatment or counseling for your emotional problems from anyone OUTSIDE the VA or military system?
Notes: 1= No. All the care I received was at the VA or in the military system; 2= Yes. SOME of my treatment was from providers who are not part of the VA and military systems; 3= Yes. ALL my treatment or counseling was from providers who are not part of the military or VA system

ElementDescription: Did you receive any medications for your emotional problems?
Did the medications help you to feel better and cope with your emotional problems?
Notes: 1= I did not take the medications; 2= I took the medications, but they did not help; 3= I took the medications, and they helped A LITTLE; 4= I took the medications, and they helped A LOT

ElementDescription: Does your child receive these services either currently or within the past year?: Emotional/behavioral therapy or counseling
How many sessions of counseling or therapy did you receive?
Notes: 1= Only 1; 2= 2 to 5; 3= 6 to 10; 4= 10 to 20; 5= More than 20 visits

ElementDescription: Did the counseling or therapy help you to feel better and cope with your emotional problems?
Notes: 1= It did not help me at all; 2= It helped me A LITTLE;  3= It helped me A LOT

ElementDescription: If you did not get any help, why? I did not think it would help me to cope with my emotional problems
If you did not get any help, why? I did not know where to go for the right kind of help
If you did not get any help, why? I was concerned about my military or VA record
Other reason participant did not get help?
Specify other reason participant did not get help
In the last 12 months, did you receive any mental health counseling or therapy at a Vet Center?
In the past 12 months, how many sessions of counseling or therapy did you receive at a Vet Center?
How satisfied were you with the counseling or therapy you received through the Vet Center?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Slightly satisfied; 2= Somewhat satisfied; 3= Very satisfied; 4= Completely satisfied

ElementDescription: In the last 12 months, did you receive any mental health counseling or therapy from a VA healthcare provider, not including Vet Centers?
How satisfied were you with the counseling or therapy you received at VA?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Slightly satisfied; 2= Somewhat satisfied; 3= Very satisfied; 4= Completely satisfied

ElementDescription: During the last 12 months did you ever feel you needed any help for mental health problems but did not seek treatment from a VA facility, including Vet Centers?
Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: I already had care outside VA that I preferred
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: I was concerned about the privacy of my military or VA record
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: Distance/too far
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: It is difficult to schedule an appointment
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: I did not think it would help me to cope with my emotional problems
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: It would harm my career
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: Other (written out)
Reason for not seeking help at VA facility: Other (rating)
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree; 1= Disagree; 2= Neutral; 3= Agree; 4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Are you currently receiving mental health treatment either through VA or in the community?
Did you end your treatment early?
For how long did you receive mental health treatment/counseling?
Notes: 1 = <2 weeks; 2= 2 weeks to <1 month; 3= 1 to <6 months; 4= 6 to <12 months; 5= 1 to <2 years; 6= More than 2 years

ElementDescription: How long has it been since you received treatment/counseling?
Notes: 1 = Less than a month                                        2= 1 to <6 months                                   3= 6 to <12 months              4= 1 to <2 years                   5= 2 or more years

ElementDescription: Reason for leaving treatment early: The treatment was too upsetting/difficult
Notes: 0= Strongly disagree                                        1= Disagree                                  2= Neutral                            3= Agree                               4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree                                        1= Disagree                                  2= Neutral                            3= Agree                               4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree                                        1= Disagree                                  2= Neutral                            3= Agree                               4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree                                        1= Disagree                                  2= Neutral                            3= Agree                               4= Strongly agree

Notes: 0= Strongly disagree                                        1= Disagree                                  2= Neutral                            3= Agree                               4= Strongly agree

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, have you used a web-based or mobile application treatment program for understanding or coping with any mental health problems?
During how many of these (2a) hospital emergency room visits were you treated for a substance use disorder related to illegal drugs or prescription pain relievers?
During the past 3 months, that is since <insert date 3 months prior>, excluding visits at #CLINIC_NAME#, how many visits did you have to an outpatient treatment program for drugs or alcohol?
Notes: 999 = Missing; If 0, skip to Q #4; CLINIC_NAME = participating primary care practice that patient was attending for medication for opioid use disorder at baseline

ElementDescription: For how many of these (3a) visits to outpatient drug or alcohol treatment did you physically visit the program?
How many of these (3a) visits to outpatient drug or alcohol treatment were by phone or online (such as by computer or tablet)?
For how many of these (3a) visits to outpatient drug or alcohol treatment did you see a medical doctor?
During how many of these (3a) visits to outpatient drug or alcohol treatment did you participate in individual or group therapy?
During the past 3 months, that is since <insert date 3 months prior>, have you received medication to treat an alcohol use disorder from anyone other than your primary care doctor?
During the past 3 months, that is since <insert date 3 months prior>, have you received medication to treat a psychiatric disorder from anyone other than your primary care doctor?

During the past 3 months, that is since <insert date 3 months prior>, excluding visits at #CLINIC_NAME# and all providers you have told us about so far, how many other visits did you have with a mental health specialist such as a psychiatrist, psychologist, social worker, counselor, addiction specialist, or certified recovery specialist? Remember by visits we mean in-person visits to a clinic, as well as telephone calls and video appointments with your providers. Please do not include stays at a hosptail or residental treatment program, or emergency room visits.
Notes: 999 = Missing; If 0, skip to Q #7; CLINIC_NAME = participating primary care practice that patient was attending for medication for opioid use disorder at baseline

ElementDescription: During how many of these (6a) visits with a mental health specialist did you discuss personal or emotional problems such as anxiety, depression, or suicidal thoughts?
During how many of these (6a) visits with a mental health specialist did you discuss a substance use disorder related to illegal drugs or prescription pain relievers?
How many of these (6a) visits with a mental health specialist were by phone or online (such as by computer or tablet)?
For how many of these (6a) visits with a mental health specialist did you see a psychiatrist? A psychiatrist is a mental health specialty doctor who prescribes medications.

During the past 3 months, that is since <insert date 3 months prior>, excluding visits at #CLINIC_NAME# and all providers you have told us about so far, how many other visits did you have with a medical provider such as a physician, nurse, nurse practitioner, or physician's assistant?
Notes: 999 = Missing; If 0, skip to Q #8; CLINIC_NAME = participating primary care practice that patient was attending for medication for opioid use disorder at baseline

ElementDescription: How many of these (7a) visits with a medical provider were by phone or online (such as by computer or tablet)?
During the past 3 months, how much of your own money have you spent on healthcare (such as copayments or prescriptions)?
Notes: 1 = Patient responded; 2 = Don't know; 3 = Patient refused; 9 = Missing. If Q8 = 2, 3, or 9, skip to Q9

ElementDescription: How much of your own money did you spen?
Notes: Dollars; looks like no restrictions in range

ElementDescription: Do you currently have health insurance?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes; 9=Missing; If No, skip to Q # 10; -88=Refuse to answer; -99=Don't know

ElementDescription: Do you have Medicaid?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes; 9=Missing; (If Yes to Q#9, interviewer asks 'What kind of insurance do you have?' (Mark all that apply) and selects yes or no responses in Q#9b-Q#9e)

ElementDescription: Do you have Medicare?
Month of the interview
Do you have Private health insurance?
Do you have Other?
Please specify other
Are you currently employed (including positions where you are paid one day at a time like day labor, or under the table)?
What is your occupation?
How many hours per week do you typically work?
How much do you make?
How much money do you make?
Notes: Dollars; looks like no restrictions in range

ElementDescription: The above earnings are:
Are you currently attending school (including vocational or trade school)?
During the past 3 months, that is since <insert date 3 months prior>, how many times did you stay overnight as an inpatient at a hospital or residential treatment program?
Are you attending full time?
How many total nights were you an inpatient for all stays?
During how many of these (1a) stays were you treated for personal or emotional problems such as anxiety, depression, or suicidal thoughts?
During how many of these (1a) stays were you treated for a substance use disorder related to illegal drugs or prescription pain relievers?
During the past 3 months, that is since <insert date 3 months prior>, how many visits did you make to a hospital emergency room?
During how many of these (2a) hospital emergency room visits were you treated for personal or emotional problems such as anxiety, depression, or suicidal thoughts?
